00030   const double twopi = 2*pi;

00033   template <class T> T cube  (T x)   { return( x*x*x );  };
00034   template <class T> T square  (T x)   { return( x*x );  };
00035   template <class T> T mmin (T x, T y) { return (x<y)?x:y; };
00036   template <class T> T mmax (T x, T y) { return (x>y)?x:y; };
00037   template <class T> T clamp (T x, T a, T b) { x=mmax(x,a); return mmin(x,b); };
00038   template <class T> void swap (T &v1, T &v2) {T w = v1;  v1 = v2;  v2 = w;};
00039   template <class T> int sign(T x) { return x>=0?1:-1; };
00040   // remove twopi and reduce x to range -pi..pi
00041   template <class T> double modpi(T x) { x = (x>=0)?fmod(double(x),twopi):(fmod(double(x),twopi)+twopi); return (x>pi)?(x-twopi):x; }; 
00042   template <class T> double modPeriod(T x,double mPeriod ) { return (x>=0)?fmod(double(x),mPeriod):(fmod(double(x),mPeriod)+mPeriod);}; // remove  period
00043   // C++ version std::string style "itoa":
00044   template <class T> std::string itoa(T value, int base) {
00045     enum { kMaxDigits = 35 };
00046     std::string buf;
00047     buf.reserve( kMaxDigits ); // Pre-allocate enough space.
00048     if (base<2||base>16) return buf;  // check that the base if valid
00049     int quotient = value;
00050     do {  // Translating number to string with base:
00051       buf += "0123456789abcdef"[abs(quotient%base)];
00052       quotient /= base;
00053     } while ( quotient );
00054     if(value<0&&base==10) buf += '-';  // Append the negative sign for base 10
00055     std::reverse(buf.begin(), buf.end());
00056     return buf;
00057   };

00059   // at return: path with ending /, ext with the first symbol .
00060  static void getPathNameExt(std::string &fullname,  std::string &path, std::string &name, std::string &ext)
00061   {
00062     std::size_t  sz1 = fullname.size()-1;
00063     for (std::size_t  i=0; i<fullname.size(); i++) if(fullname[i]=='\\') fullname[i] = '/'; 
00064     std::size_t  j = fullname.find_last_of("/");
00065     if(j==std::string::npos) {
00066       name = fullname;
00067       path = "";
00068     }
00069     else {
00070       name = (j<sz1)?fullname.substr(j+1):"";         // filename;
00071       path = (j<sz1)?fullname.substr(0,j+1):fullname; // file path
00072     }
00073     std::size_t  i = name.find_last_of(".");
00074     ext = (i!=std::string::npos)?name.substr(i):"";   // file extention
00075     if(i!=std::string::npos) name.resize(i);          // discard file extention
00076   }

00078 //******************************************************************************
00079 // Checks to see if a directory exists. Note: This method only checks the
00080 // existence of the full path AND if path leaf is a dir.
00081 // 
00082 // @return  >0 if dir exists AND is a dir,
00083 //           0 if dir does not exist OR exists but not a dir,
00084 //          <0 if an error occurred (errno is also set)
00085 static int isDir(const char* path)
00086 {
00087   struct stat info;
00088   int statRC = stat( path, &info );
00089   if(statRC != 0 ){
00090     if(errno == ENOENT)  { return 0; } // something along the path does not exist
00091     if(errno == ENOTDIR) { return 0; } // something in path prefix is not a dir
00092     return -1;
00093   }
00094   int k = (info.st_mode&S_IFDIR)?1:0;
00095   return k;
00096 }

00098 //******************************************************************************
00099 // Create folder subdir in user %TEMP% forder
00100 // @return full path to the %TEMP%\subdir with a trailing slash
00101 static std::string createTempSubdir(std::string &subdir)
00102 {
00103 #ifdef WIN32
00104   const char *key[] = {"TMP", "TEMP", "USERPROFILE", NULL};
00105 #else
00106   const char *key[] = {"TMPDIR", "TMP", "TEMP", "TEMPDIR","USERPROFILE", NULL};
00107 #endif
00108   char *val;
00109   for(int i=0; key[i]!=NULL; i++) {
00110     val = getenv(key[i]);
00111     if(val) break;
00112   }
00113 #ifdef WIN32
00114   std::string path = (val==NULL)?std::string(""):std::string(val);
00115   if(path[path.size()-1]=='\\') path.resize(path.size()-1);
00116   path += "\\";
00117   path += subdir;
00118   std::string mkdir("mkdir "); 
00119   mkdir += path;
00120   int k = isDir(path.c_str());
00121   path += "\\";
00122 #else
00123   std::string path = (val==NULL)?std::string("/tmp"):std::string(val);
00124   if(path[path.size()-1]=='/') path.resize(path.size()-1);
00125   path += "/";
00126   path += subdir;
00127   std::string mkdir("mkdir -p "); 
00128   mkdir += path;
00129   int k = isDir(path.c_str());
00130   path += "/";
00131 #endif
00132   if(k==0) system(mkdir.c_str());
00133   return path;
00134 }

00136 //******************************************************************************
00137 // Create unique name for temporary file in current working directory
00138 // name is the guess name
00139 // name is the full filename with the path or name for file in the current working directory
00140 // @return name for temporary file
00141 static std::string createUniqueFilename(const std::string &name)
00142 {
00143   std::string tmpname = name;
00144   for(int n=1;;++n) {
00145     FILE* fp = ::fopen(tmpname.c_str(),"r");   // try to open
00146     if(fp==0) {
00147       int k = isDir(tmpname.c_str());
00148       if(k<=0) break; // break if not found
00149     }
00150     if(fp) ::fclose(fp);
00151     std::ostringstream os;
00152     os<<name<<"_"<<n;
00153     tmpname=os.str();
00154   }
00155   return tmpname;
00156 }

00158 //******************************************************************************
00159 // Create unique subdir at directory path.
00160 // path is the directory path
00161 // subdir is the guess name for subdir
00162 // @return path to temporary subdir 
00163 static std::string createUniqueSubdir(const std::string &path,const std::string &subdir)
00164 {
00165   std::string subdir1 = subdir;
00166   std::string tmpname;
00167   for(int n=1;;++n) {
00168     tmpname = path+subdir1;
00169     int err = isDir(tmpname.c_str());
00170     if(!(err>0)) break; // break if not found
00171     std::ostringstream os;
00172     os<<subdir<<"_"<<n;
00173     subdir1=os.str();
00174   }
00175 #ifdef WIN32
00176   std::string mkdir("mkdir "); 
00177   mkdir += tmpname;
00178   tmpname += "\\";
00179 #else
00180   std::string mkdir("mkdir -p "); 
00181   mkdir += tmpname;
00182   tmpname += "/";
00183 #endif
00184   system(mkdir.c_str());
00185   return tmpname;
00186 }

00188 //Create directory for output files.
00189 // @return the path of the directory created or empty std::string  
00190 static std::string createOutputDir(std::string &outputFile)
00191 {
00192  // std::string path = getPath(outputFile); //get absolute path from the full filename
00193   std::string path, name, ext;
00194   mathf::getPathNameExt(outputFile,path,name,ext);
00195   if(path[path.size()-1 ]=='/') path.resize(path.size()-1);
00196 #ifdef WIN32
00197   std::replace(path.begin(),path.end(), '/', '\\');
00198 //    _mkdir(path.c_str());
00199   std::string mkdir("mkdir "); 
00200   mkdir += path;
00201   int k = isDir(path.c_str());
00202 #else
00203   std::string mkdir("mkdir -p "); 
00204   mkdir += path;
00205   int k = isDir(path.c_str());
00206   //int status = mkdir("/home/fsk/TMP", S_IRWXU | S_IRWXG | S_IROTH | S_IXOTH);
00207 #endif
00208   if(k==0) system(mkdir.c_str());
00209   if (isDir(path.c_str())<=0) path.clear();
00210   return path;
00211 }

00217 class StopWatch {
00218   clock_t tStart;
00219   clock_t tSplit;
00220   clock_t tElapsed;
00221   bool started;
00222   bool splited;
00223   bool suspended;
00224   bool doPrint;
00225 public:
00227   StopWatch() {
00228     reset();
00229     doPrint=true;
00230   };
00232   void setPrint(bool flag) {
00233     doPrint=flag;
00234   };
00236   void reset() {
00237     started=splited=suspended=false; 
00238     tStart=tSplit=tElapsed=0;
00239   };
00241   void start()   {
00242     if(started) return;
00243     reset();
00244     started = true; 
00245     tStart = clock(); 
00246   };
00248   void restart() {
00249     stop();
00250     start();
00251   };
00253   void stop()    {
00254     if(!started) return; 
00255     clock_t tStop  = clock(); 
00256     if(suspended) tStop =tStart;
00257     tElapsed +=tStop-tStart; 
00258     started=false; 
00259   };
00261   void split()   {
00262     if(!started || splited) return;
00263     if(suspended) 
00264       tSplit = tElapsed;
00265     else
00266       tSplit = tElapsed + clock()-tStart; 
00267     splited = true;
00268   };
00270   void unsplit() {
00271     if(!started || !splited) return;
00272     tSplit = 0;
00273     splited = false;
00274   };
00276   void suspend() {
00277     if(!started || suspended) return; 
00278     tElapsed += clock()-tStart;
00279     suspended = true;
00280   };
00282   void resume()  {
00283     if(!started || !suspended) return; 
00284     tStart  = clock();
00285     suspended = false;
00286   };
00288   double getTime() {
00289     if(!started || suspended) return double(tElapsed)/CLOCKS_PER_SEC; 
00290     clock_t t = tElapsed + (clock()-tStart);
00291     return double(t)/CLOCKS_PER_SEC; 
00292   };
00293   void printTime(const char * comment,bool reStart=false) {
00294     if(doPrint) 
00295       std::cout<<comment<<" "<<getTime()<<"s"<<std::endl;
00296     if(reStart) restart();
00297   };
00299   double getSplitTime() {
00300     if(!splited || !started) return 0; 
00301     return double(tSplit)/CLOCKS_PER_SEC; 
00302   };
00303 };

00325   template < typename pT > class vectorOfPtr: public std::vector< pT >
00326   {
00327     protected:
00328       pT This(int i) {return std::vector<pT>::at(i);} // get element at position i
00329     public:
00330     ~vectorOfPtr() {
00331       clear();
00332     }
00333     void clear() {
00334       if(std::vector<pT>::empty()) return;
00335       for (unsigned int i = 0; i < std::vector<pT>::size(); i++) {
00336          delete std::vector<pT>::at(i); 
00337       }
00338       std::vector< pT >::clear();
00339     }
00340     void resize(int n) {
00341       clear();
00342       std::vector<pT>::resize(n);
00343     }
00344   };

00346 // wrap an allocation by new to ensure destruction when control leaves a scope.
00347   template < typename T > class autoPtr  {
00348     T *data;
00349     autoPtr(int n) {data = new T[n];}
00350   public:
00351     autoPtr() {data = 0;}
00352     autoPtr(T* d) {data = d;}
00353     ~autoPtr() { delete[] data; }
00354     T* get() const {return data;}
00355     T *operator->() const {return (get());}
00356     T& operator*() const {return (*get());}
00357     autoPtr &operator = ( autoPtr &v ) {
00358       if( this != &v) {
00359         delete[] data;
00360         data = v.data;
00361         v.data = 0;
00362       }
00363       return( *this );
00364     }
00365   };
00366 
00367 #define MATHFNEWARRAY(T, y, n) mathf::autoPtr<T> alloc__##y(new T[n]); T *y = alloc__##y.get();
00368 #define MATHFNEWOBJECT(T, y) mathf::autoPtr<T> alloc__##y(new T); T *y = alloc__##y.get();

00374 //_WIN32 is Defined for applications for Win32 and Win64. Always defined.
00375 #if defined( _WIN32 ) 
00376     #ifdef _MSC_VER
00377       #if _MSC_VER > 1200       // Visual Studio higher than 6
00378 /* class auto_ptr
00379  * - improved standard conforming implementation
00380  wrap an allocation by new to ensure destruction when control leaves a scope.
00381 
00382 The following code example is taken from the book
00383 The C++ Standard Library - A Tutorial and Reference
00384 by Nicolai M. Josuttis, Addison-Wesley, 1999
00385 © Copyright Nicolai M. Josuttis 1999
00386 
00387  */
00388     // auxiliary type to enable copies and assignments (now global)
00389     template<class Y>
00390     struct auto_ptr_ref {
00391         Y* yp;
00392         auto_ptr_ref (Y* rhs)
00393          : yp(rhs) {
00394         }
00395     };
00396 
00397     template<class T>
00398     class auto_ptr {
00399       private:
00400         T* ap;    // refers to the actual owned object (if any)
00401       public:
00402         typedef T element_type;
00403         // constructor
00404         explicit auto_ptr (T* ptr = 0) throw() : ap(ptr) { }
00405         // copy constructors (with implicit conversion)
00406         // - note: nonconstant parameter
00407         auto_ptr (auto_ptr& rhs) throw() : ap(rhs.release()) { }
00408         template<class Y>
00409         auto_ptr (auto_ptr<Y>& rhs) throw() : ap(rhs.release()) { }
00410         // assignments (with implicit conversion)
00411         // - note: nonconstant parameter
00412         auto_ptr& operator= (auto_ptr& rhs) throw() {
00413             reset(rhs.release());
00414             return *this;
00415         }
00416         template<class Y>
00417         auto_ptr& operator= (auto_ptr<Y>& rhs) throw() {
00418             reset(rhs.release());
00419             return *this;
00420         }
00421         // destructor
00422         ~auto_ptr() throw() { delete ap; }
00423         // value access
00424         T* get() const throw() { return ap; }
00425         T& operator*() const throw() { return *ap; }
00426         T* operator->() const throw() {  return ap; }
00427         // release ownership
00428         T* release() throw() {
00429             T* tmp(ap);
00430             ap = 0;
00431             return tmp;
00432         }
00433         // reset value
00434         void reset (T* ptr=0) throw() {
00435             if (ap != ptr) {
00436                 delete ap;
00437                 ap = ptr;
00438             }
00439         }
00440         // special conversions with auxiliary type to enable copies and assignments
00441         auto_ptr(auto_ptr_ref<T> rhs) throw() : ap(rhs.yp) {  }
00442         auto_ptr& operator= (auto_ptr_ref<T> rhs) throw() {  // new
00443              reset(rhs.yp);
00444              return *this;
00445         }
00446         template<class Y>
00447         operator auto_ptr_ref<Y>() throw() { return auto_ptr_ref<Y>(release()); }
00448         template<class Y>
00449         operator auto_ptr<Y>() throw() { return auto_ptr<Y>(release()); }
00450     };
00451 
00452 #endif
00453 #endif
00454 #endif
00455 
00456 };
